episodeTitle: Eliminated Friends - The Final Day of the Straw Hat Crew
description: The Straw Hat Pirates face their ultimate defeat as Bartholomew Kuma systematically separates the crew one by one, sending each member flying to unknown locations. Despite Luffy's desperate attempts and Rayleigh's battle with Admiral Kizaru, the crew is completely scattered, marking a devastating turning point in their journey.

events.title: Brook Vanishes - First Crew Member Disappears
events.description: Brook becomes the first crew member to be sent away by Kuma's powers in this episode. He attempts to fight back but is effortlessly struck by Kuma's paw, causing him to disappear in a bubble-like effect while making a final bone joke before vanishing.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the systematic separation of the Straw Hat crew, setting the tone for the devastating episode as the crew members are helplessly picked off one by one.

quotes.text: Looks like I'm going on a trip... Skull joke!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's final words before disappearing, staying in character even in defeat

events.title: Usopp's Desperate Stand and Disappearance
events.description: Usopp attempts to hold Kuma back despite his fear, trying to protect what remains of the crew. He fires at Kuma with his slingshot but is quickly overwhelmed. Kuma touches him with his paw, and Usopp vanishes while crying out in terror and despair.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's courage despite his fear, willing to stand against an impossibly strong opponent to protect his friends. His disappearance further emphasizes the crew's helplessness.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's brave but futile attempt to stop Kuma

events.title: Sanji's Rage and Vanishing
events.description: An enraged Sanji charges at Kuma after witnessing Usopp's disappearance, attempting to attack with his powerful kicks. However, Kuma easily deflects his attacks and touches Sanji with his paw. Sanji disappears mid-attack, unable to land a single blow.
events.significance: Shows that even the crew's strongest fighters cannot harm Kuma, emphasizing the overwhelming power difference. Sanji's anger and desperation highlight the emotional weight of watching crewmates disappear.

quotes.text: Damn you! I won't let you—
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's final words before vanishing, cut off mid-sentence

events.title: Franky's Disappearance
events.description: Franky attempts to use his cyborg weapons against Kuma but is completely outmatched. Despite his mechanical enhancements and firepower, Kuma approaches him calmly and strikes him with his paw, causing Franky to vanish in the same manner as the others.
events.significance: Even Franky's technological advantages prove useless against Kuma's overwhelming power, further driving home the crew's complete defeat.

events.title: Nami's Tearful Disappearance
events.description: Nami, terrified and crying, calls out for help as Kuma approaches her. Despite her pleas and Luffy's desperate attempts to reach her, Kuma touches her and she vanishes. Her frightened cries echo as she disappears, leaving only empty space where she stood.
events.significance: One of the most emotionally devastating moments as Nami's terror and helplessness are on full display. Her disappearance particularly affects Luffy, who promised to protect his crew but is powerless to stop Kuma.

events.title: Chopper's Innocent Plea
events.description: Chopper, in his small, vulnerable form, looks up at Kuma with tears in his eyes, asking why he's doing this. Without answering, Kuma touches the young doctor with his paw, and Chopper disappears while crying out for his captain.
events.significance: Chopper's innocent confusion and fear add to the emotional weight of the scene. The disappearance of the crew's youngest and most innocent member emphasizes the cruelty of their defeat.

events.title: Robin's Silent Departure
events.description: Nico Robin, understanding the futility of resistance, stands quietly as Kuma approaches. With a resigned expression, she accepts her fate as Kuma touches her, and she vanishes without struggling. Her calm acceptance contrasts with the panic of the others.
events.significance: Robin's quiet acceptance reflects her mature understanding of their situation and her trust in her captain, even in this moment of complete defeat. Her disappearance leaves Luffy truly alone.

events.title: Sentomaru Explains Kuma's Ability
events.description: Sentomaru reveals the true nature of Kuma's power - when struck by Kuma's paws, victims are sent flying for three days and three nights to locations only Kuma knows. This explanation confirms that the crew members aren't killed but have been scattered to unknown locations across the world.
events.significance: Provides crucial information about Kuma's Devil Fruit ability and confirms that the crew members are alive but separated. This revelation gives a glimmer of hope while emphasizing how far apart they've been sent.

quotes.text: When Kuma slaps someone with his paw pads, they will be flying for three days and nights. Only Kuma knows where they end up.
quotes.speaker: Sentomaru

events.title: Kuma's Mysterious Message to Rayleigh
events.description: Kuma approaches Silvers Rayleigh, who is still engaged with Admiral Kizaru, and whispers something to him. Rayleigh appears shocked and questions what Kuma is doing. Kuma asks Rayleigh to trust him, hinting at a hidden plan or motive behind his actions.
events.significance: Reveals that Kuma's actions may not be as malicious as they appear. The secret communication with Rayleigh suggests Kuma is working toward a different goal, planting seeds of a major plot revelation about Kuma's true allegiance and intentions.

quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma's whispered request to Rayleigh after revealing his plan

events.title: Luffy's Complete Breakdown
events.description: Alone and having witnessed all his crewmates disappear, Luffy collapses to the ground in complete despair. He cries out in anguish, repeatedly screaming that he couldn't save even a single one of his friends. He beats the ground with his fists, overcome with grief and self-blame, experiencing his most devastating defeat.
events.significance: This is Luffy's lowest point in the entire series up to this moment. His complete emotional breakdown showcases the weight of leadership and responsibility he feels for his crew. This moment of utter defeat becomes a crucial catalyst for his growth and training during the timeskip.

quotes.text: I couldn't even save a single one of them... Not even one...!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's anguished cry after all his crewmates have disappeared

events.title: Luffy's Disappearance - The Final Straw Hat Falls
events.description: Kuma approaches the grief-stricken Luffy and tells him they will never meet one another again. Before Luffy can react, Kuma touches him with his paw, and Luffy disappears in a burst of light. With Luffy gone, the Straw Hat Pirates have been completely scattered, marking the end of their journey together and the conclusion of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc.
events.significance: The disappearance of the captain marks the complete defeat of the Straw Hat Pirates. This moment ends an era of their journey and sets up the two-year timeskip. It's one of the most pivotal moments in One Piece, fundamentally changing the trajectory of the story.

quotes.text: You will never meet one another again. Farewell.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma's final words to Luffy before sending him away

events.title: Rayleigh Continues Battle with Kizaru
events.description: Throughout the episode, Silvers Rayleigh continues his battle against Admiral Kizaru, preventing the Admiral from interfering as Kuma systematically eliminates the Straw Hats. The fight keeps both powerful combatants occupied, showing Rayleigh's strength while emphasizing his inability to help the crew.
events.significance: Demonstrates Rayleigh's incredible power as he holds off an Admiral, but also shows the limits of even legendary pirates when faced with multiple enemies. His distraction by Kizaru makes him unable to stop Kuma's plan.

quotes.text: I couldn't even save a single one of them... Not even one...!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's breakdown after watching all his crewmates disappear

quotes.text: You will never meet one another again. Farewell.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma's ominous final words to Luffy before sending him away

quotes.text: When Kuma slaps someone with his paw pads, they will be flying for three days and nights. Only Kuma knows where they end up.
quotes.speaker: Sentomaru
quotes.context: Explaining the mechanics of Kuma's teleportation ability

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's desperate cry as Kuma approaches her

themes.description: The episode powerfully explores the theme of complete defeat and powerlessness. Despite their growth and victories, the Straw Hats are utterly helpless against Kuma's overwhelming power, unable to protect each other or themselves.
themes.symbolism: The bubble-like effect when each crew member disappears symbolizes the fragility of their bonds when faced with overwhelming force. Each popping bubble represents a broken promise and shattered dream.

themes.description: Luffy's breakdown showcases the immense burden of being a captain. His inability to protect his crew crushes him emotionally, revealing that being a leader means carrying the responsibility for everyone's safety.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's physical collapse to the ground mirrors his emotional and spiritual collapse as a captain who has failed his crew.

themes.description: The systematic separation of the crew members one by one creates a devastating sense of loss. Each disappearance compounds the tragedy, building to Luffy's complete isolation.
themes.symbolism: The crew members vanishing into thin air represents the sudden and complete nature of loss - one moment they're there, the next they're gone without a trace.

themes.description: Kuma's mysterious message to Rayleigh introduces the theme that not everything is as it appears. What seems like a cruel act of destruction may have a hidden benevolent purpose.
themes.symbolism: Kuma's stoic, emotionless demeanor while systematically separating the crew contrasts with his request for Rayleigh to trust him, suggesting deeper motivations.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy experiences his most crushing defeat, unable to protect even a single crew member. His complete breakdown shows a vulnerable side rarely seen, marking a crucial moment in his development as both a pirate and a leader.
keyActions: Desperately tries to reach each crew member as they disappear
Transforms into Gear Second in futile attempt to stop Kuma
Collapses in complete despair after all crew members vanish
Screams in anguish about his failure to save anyone
Becomes the final crew member to be sent away
quotes: I couldn't even save a single one of them... Not even one...!

characterSpotlights.development: Kuma's role becomes more complex as he systematically defeats the Straw Hats while hinting at hidden motives through his conversation with Rayleigh. His actions appear cruel but his message suggests a different purpose.
keyActions: Systematically sends each Straw Hat crew member flying to unknown locations
Reveals his teleportation ability's mechanics through Sentomaru
Whispers a mysterious message to Rayleigh asking for trust
Shows no emotion or hesitation while defeating the crew
Sends Luffy away last after telling him they'll never meet again
quotes: You will never meet one another again. Farewell.

characterSpotlights.development: Despite his legendary power, Rayleigh is unable to help the Straw Hats as he's occupied fighting Kizaru. His conversation with Kuma reveals he may understand more about Kuma's true intentions than others.
keyActions: Continues fighting Admiral Kizaru throughout the episode
Questions Kuma's actions but appears to understand on some level
Unable to prevent the crew's separation despite his power

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the emotional impact of each crew member's disappearance with additional reaction shots and prolonged scenes of Luffy's anguish, making the episode more emotionally devastating than the manga chapter.
The anime added more detailed flashback sequences showing previous moments with each crew member as they disappear, emphasizing the bonds being broken.
The eyecatchers in this episode lacked their typical musical leitmotifs due to the serious and tragic tone of the episode, an anime-only production choice.

trivia.fact: Episode 405 has an IMDb rating of 9.7/10 based on 47,000 votes, making it one of the highest-rated episodes in the entire One Piece anime series.
This episode marks the finale of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and the last time the Straw Hat crew appears together until their reunion two years later in the story.
The episode's title in Japanese uses 'Kiesareta' (消された) which means 'erased' or 'eliminated', emphasizing the finality of the crew's disappearance.
The eyecatchers (mid-episode breaks) featured Luffy but without the typical musical leitmotifs, a rare production choice that reflected the episode's serious and somber tone.
This episode covers Chapter 513 of the manga, titled 'I Couldn't Even...!!!' (届かなかった...!!!, Todokanakatta...!!!), one of the most emotionally impactful chapters in One Piece.
The bubble imagery used when crew members disappear is a callback to the Sabaody Archipelago's signature bubbles, with each crew member's disappearance represented by a bubble popping.
Episode 405 aired on June 14, 2009 in Japan and had a TV rating of 10.0%, ranking 5th in viewership for its time slot.
This episode represents the first time in the series that the Straw Hat Pirates are completely defeated and separated, marking a major turning point in the narrative structure of One Piece.
